metadata.name: Mercury
metadata.description:
Mercury, born on Mount Cileno in Greece, son of Jupiter and the nymph Maia.
Transcendental god of Roman mythology. Ancient manuscripts say that he stole the arrows
from Apollo, the trident from Neptune and the saber from Mars, all in order to be able to
negotiate with them.
Not for nothing, this God is linked to trade and merchandise, as well as considered
protector of thieves.

The gods gave him the Caduceus, the rod of oblivion. With a clear representation of the
balance between two antagonistic forces, recognized for its representation of the eternal
movement and in order to be its messenger, it negotiated and guided the souls of the dead to
the entrance of Hades. In his role as a psychopomp, he guided people to the other side of
existence, reflecting another way of understanding reality. Connected with the world of
dreams, art, visions that approach madness, whoever did not know his objective function in
life, would be guided by him, based on personal discovery.
